H0.text: Earth's gravitational attraction to the Sun is the most important factor in producing the seasons on Earth.

H1.text: The Moon's revolution around Earth is the most important factor in producing the seasons on Earth.

H2.text: The distance of Earth from the Sun is the most important factor in producing the seasons on Earth.

H3.text: The tilt of Earth's axis as it revolves around the Sun is most important in producing the seasons on Earth.

A4.text: Summer occurs in the Northern Hemisphere when the North Pole is directed toward and the South Pole away from the Sun.

A5.text: This is the cause of Earth's seasons.
